summary: An email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York to the FBI, following up on the processing of electronic evidence seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence and inquiring about the status of materials from his private island. The email expresses concern about the timing of evidence processing.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: Author of the email, following up with the FBI about the status of electronic evidence processing from searches of Epstein's properties.

events.title: Search of Epstein's New York Residence
events.description: Electronic evidence, including approximately 5-6 iMacs and 5 laptop computers, was seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence and is being processed by CART.

events.title: Seizure of Materials from Private Island
events.description: Materials were seized from Jeffrey Epstein's private island, but the FBI had not yet started processing them as of the date of this email.

locations: Private island (of Jeffrey Epstein, likely Little St. James)
keyFacts: Electronic evidence from a search of Epstein's New York residence included approximately 5-6 iMacs and 5 laptop computers.
Processing of the New York residence evidence by CART was anticipated to be completed for upload to Relativity in late October 2019.
The FBI had not yet started processing materials seized from Epstein's private island as of November 2019.
The prosecutor expressed concern about the timing of evidence processing, noting the New York materials were 'just the tip of the iceberg'.
